page.title: 03East Wryde Farm, Thorney
page.content: To the east of{Thorney}is a farm called{East Wryde Farm,}and we interviewed the farmer who lives there He owns, altogether,{1,768 acres}which is made up of{66 separate fields.}He owns{134 acres}of{sugar beet, 1,000 {acres}of{winter wheat, 220 acres}of {vining peas, 148 acres}of{oil seed {rape,}and the rest of the acreage is used for{potatoes,}and{winter {barley.}Crops like{potatoes, sugar {beet}and{vining peas}are used as{break {crops}to give a{rotation}with{winter {cereals.}He employs{13 workers, including the ones that come to{pick {the potatoes}and{help with the {harvest.}His wife works as a general worker and sometimes drives tractors. We asked the farmer where in the world would he best like a field. He said{"Thorney Fen!"
